meanings.definition: A person who pads or stuffs.
meanings.sent1: The padders worked diligently to stuff the pillows.
meanings.sent2: The new employee at the furniture store became an expert padders.
meanings.sent3: The padders at the factory had a friendly competition to see who could stuff the most teddy bears.
meanings.sent4: She was a true padder, always adding extra layers of padding to her homemade quilts.
meanings.sent5: The little girl watched in amazement as the skilled padder filled the chair with soft material.

meanings.definition: A piece of soft material used to protect or fill out a shape.
meanings.sent1: The delicate vase was wrapped in padders to keep it safe during the move.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used padders to give the dress a fuller silhouette.
meanings.sent3: The padders in the packaging prevented the fragile items from breaking during shipping.
meanings.sent4: The clouds in the sky looked like fluffy padders floating above us.
meanings.sent5: She placed the padders around the edges of the box to cushion the fragile contents.

meanings.definition: A type of footwear, typically worn indoors.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, she slipped on her cozy padders.
meanings.sent2: The children loved their colorful padders with cartoon characters on them.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally wore his padders to the grocery store, much to the amusement of other shoppers.
meanings.sent4: The soft padders felt like walking on clouds as she moved around the house.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy padders kept her feet warm and comfortable during the cold winter nights.
